result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah P Farrington

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah P Farrington appeared by video.  Attorney Louis E. Elder appeared by video for Isaiah P Farrington.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court on behalf of Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Court addresses defense's motion filed. Court further schedules the next court date for a motion hearing, and sets 12/21/2022 deadline for the state's reply. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress, filed
Motion to Dismiss, filed by defense

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court with attorney Louis E. Elder.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Defense, further requests a Motion Hearing date. Court informs defense that she only schedules motions upon one being filed. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference and sets 09/06/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 066618,
Payable Number: 1019649,
Receipt Number: 22RP028378,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw. Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Additional appearance made by attorney Louis Elder.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Attorney Rakestraw informs court that he is seeking withdrawal of counsel, as attorney Elder was retained on a pro bono basis.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney Rakestraw is to exchange all of the necessary documentation for case to new counsel. Court further orders Attorney Elder to file a formal notice of retainer with the court. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Attorney Elder was not able to appear, defendant states he has paid retainer fee. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Defendant is working on retaining Attorney Elder. Case is adjourned to 1:30pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court, via zoom, with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have been extended a global offer, but need additional time to review it with client. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription,or any dangerous weapons or firearms.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah P Farrington in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
